attributes.comment:
Dear Sir or Madame:

I understand that this rule proposes to adjust the immigration and naturalization
benefit application and petition fees of the Immigration Examinations Fee
Account.

I also understand that this fee structure's history is:
1985 $50.00
1989 $100.00
1991 $140.00
1994 $155.00
1998 $405.00
2002 $460.00
2004 $525.00
2005 $545.00

For parents who are attempting to adopt a child from China,their fees are
approximately $18,000.00. I think continuing to raise fees at the level stated here
are a bit excessive. And what about the duplication of efforts when parents must
be fingerprinted by the State of Michigan as well as being fingerprinted by the
USCIS as well. Streamlining services is one benefit, however, paying a 60%
increase in fees in one year does not appear to be justified.
Thank you,
Sincerely,
Shelley
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Shelley Van Riper
